official-title.#text:
To establish an advisory office within the Bureau of
		  Consumer Protection of the Federal Trade Commission to prevent fraud targeting
		  seniors, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Office for the
			 Prevention of Fraud Targeting Seniors

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish an office within the
for the purpose of advising the

on the prevention of
			 fraud targeting seniors and to assist the

quote.#tail:
) targeting seniors and shall coordinate with other
			 relevant agencies regarding the requirements of this section.

text.#text:
The advisory office shall monitor the
			 market for mail, television, Internet, and telemarketing fraud including
			 recorded message telephone calls (hereinafter referred to as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: through the advisory office shall, after consultation with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
Chief Postal Inspector for the United States Postal Inspection Service

text.#text:
disseminate to seniors and families and
			 caregivers of seniors general information on mail, television, Internet,
			 telemarketing, and robocall fraud targeting seniors, including descriptions of
			 the most common fraud schemes;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for reporting such complaints, or to the Consumer Sentinel Network,
			 operated by the

, where such complaints will become immediately
			 available to appropriate law enforcement agencies, including the
and the attorneys general of the States;

text.#text:
disseminate to seniors and families and
			 caregivers of seniors information on reporting complaints of fraud targeting
			 seniors either to the national toll-free telephone number established by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for mail, television, Internet,
			 telemarketing, and robocall fraud against such entity; and

text.#text:
in response to a specific request about a
			 particular entity or individual, provide publically available information of
			 enforcement action taken by the

maintain a website to serve as a resource
			 for information for seniors and families and caregivers of seniors regarding
			 mail, television, Internet, telemarketing, robocall, and other identified fraud
			 targeting seniors.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
through the advisory office
			 shall, after consultation with the

text.#text:
log and acknowledge the receipt of
			 complaints by individuals who believe they have been a victim of mail,
			 television, Internet, telemarketing, and robocall fraud in the Consumer
			 Sentinel Network, and must make those complaints immediately available to
			 Federal, State, and local law enforcement authorities; and

internal-xref.#tail:
, and to any other
			 persons, specific and general information on mail, television, telemarketing
			 and robocall fraud, including descriptions of the most common schemes using
			 such methods of communication.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall commence carrying out the requirements of this section not
			 later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act.
